title: Drawing, 1917-4-22, ca. 1853
inscribed: Recto:  Inscribed in graphite ? with figures as follows at top right: 1 green 4 red / 5 purple / 2 yellow 6 blue / 3 orange; at bottom: Every object visible through the rainbow   / This effect was peculiar / wonderful and glorious / At 2 wonderful intensity of light gradually fading / general effect not like a rainbow being more like a burst / of splendid fires, and bearing a resemblance to the Aurora Borealis / in the peculiar radiations -- explained by the streaks of rain / the blue and green (as well as the other colors) were intense.
description:
Recto: Cloudy sky and rain over mountain ridges.
Verso: Graphite scratchings.
